intro: Oreomunnea guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan oreomunnea, is a flowering plant species native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique morphological features. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and produces small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
